word_mean: 生物体在其个体发生中重演其系统发生的过程。

sentence.Network_en: The statistical recapitulation of the Long March is impressive.
sentence.Network_cn: 长征的统计数字是触目惊心的.

sentence.Network_en: Recent history of sedimentation is seen to be a recapitulation of the past.
sentence.Network_cn: 近代沉积史看来就是过去沉积史的重演.

sentence.Network_en: The work of Lambert, Schweikart and Taurinus constitutes advances in mathematies that warrant recapitulation.
sentence.Network_cn: Lambert, Schweikart和Taurinus的工作在数学上所得的进展是理应扼要介绍的.

生物学词汇英语翻译(Q-Z) ... rec assay 列克分析 recapitulation 重演 recapitulation theory 重演说.
rearrangement 重新配置recapitulation 再现receiving surface 接收面
recall value 回忆价recapitulation 复述recapitulation theory 复演说

list.abs: 达尔文进化论使得胚胎学比以前更流行，因为胚胎被看作进化的证据。其中，特别具有影响力的是颇具争议的重演说(recapitulation theory)，该理论宣称单个有机体的生物发育或个体发育(ontogeny)概括了其所在物种整个进化发展过程或发展.

...相等)，他们的父子兄弟中只有1个名人。由此，他得出“名人家族中出名人的比率大大超过一般人”的结论，从而认为这就是能力受遗传决定的证据。美国儿童心理学家霍尔提出的“复演说”(recapitulation theory)也属于内发论。霍尔说过： “一两的遗传胜过一吨教育。”他把当时生物学上的复演说用来解释儿童心理的发展，认为个体心理发展是人类进化过程的简单重复，个体心理发展是由种系发展决定的。<.
biochemical reaction 生物化学反应biochemical recapitulation 生化重演biochemistry 生物化学
proxy statement 股东签署的委托书recapitulation statement 摘要表, 汇总表reconciliation statement 调节表; (会计)对帐表.
...动物发生率编辑动物发生率(biogenetic law)也叫重演律(recapitulation law)，生物在个体发育过程中总是重演其所有祖先在进化过程中的每个发育阶段，即生物的个体发育过程重演其祖先的系统发生过程，是德国人赫克尔(E.H.Haeckel)用生物进化论的观点总结.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French recapitulation or late Latin recapitulatio(n-), from the verb recapitulare (see recapitulate)

entry.def: You can say that you are going to recapitulate the main points of an explanation, argument, or description when you want to draw attention to the fact that you are going to repeat the most important points as a summary.

example.ex: Let's just recapitulate the essential points...
example.tran: 我们再来回顾一下要点。

example.ex: It will shortly be put up for sale under the terms already communicated to you, which, to recapitulate, call for a very minimum of publicity.
example.tran: 不久它就可以上市，按照我们与你商定的条款进行销售，重申一遍，这些条款尽量不要对外公开。

means.word_mean: 1. emergence during embryonic development of various characters or structures that appeared during the evolutionary history of the strain or species
2. a section of a musical composition or movement in which themes introduced earlier are repeated
3. a summary at the end that repeats the substance of a longer discussion

auth_sentence.content: A brief recapitulation of the salient features of Bill's life.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: A brief recapitulation of the salient features of Bill's life.

auth_sentence.content: It's a sterile recapitulation, a sterile release of tension.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's a sterile recapitulation, a sterile release of tension.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's a sterile recapitulation, a sterile release of tension.

auth_sentence.content: The recapitulation theory...holds...that ontogeny repeats phylogeny.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The recapitulation theory...holds...that ontogeny repeats phylogeny.
